title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 March 2009 - XWiki
content:
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 02:29): XWiki.GongBeidou was modified by XWiki.GongBeidou (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/GongBeidou  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 02:30): XWiki.GongBeidou was modified by XWiki.GongBeidou (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/GongBeidou  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 02:30): XWiki.GongBeidou was modified by XWiki.GongBeidou (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/GongBeidou  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 03:46): ldubost : hi ldubost  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 03:48): ldubost: thanks a lot ldubost for the mail.  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 09:56): XWiki.Tamermf was modified by XWiki.Tamermf (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Tamermf  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 10:09): Design.NewSearchInterface was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/NewSearchInterface  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 10:10): Design.NewSearchInterface was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/NewSearchInterface  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 12:42): DevGuide.Pagination was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Pagination  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 12:42): DevGuide.Pagination was modified by xwiki:XWiki.evalica - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Pagination  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 17:31): DevGuide.API was modified by xwiki:XWiki.ThomasMortagne - http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/API  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:54): jvelociter  : Hi need some help ,  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:55): Hi arunreddy   
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:55): what's up ?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:55): Hi   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:55): am planning to do the tutorial of creating a plugin  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:55): can you kidnly tell me XWikiPluginInterface  and defautl XWIKIPlugin api  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:56): which am suppose to extend.  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:56): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/CreatingPlugins  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:57): you can check the tag plugin as an example  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:57): let me find you a URL  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 17:57): thanks  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:57): http://fisheye2.atlassian.com/browse/xwiki/platform/xwiki-plugins/trunk/tag/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/tag  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:58): this is a basic plugin with a separate API class to be exposed to velocity scripting  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:58): note that as it is said, plugins are the old way of doing things  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:58): you might be interested by the components tutorial once you are done with this one  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:59): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 17:59): basically here is how you chose between a component implementation and a plugin implementation :  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:00): whats the basic difference.?  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:00): - if your code needs to access a lot of data in the wiki (objects, classes, etc) then you probably prefer to implement it as a plugin, since as a component you will lack that acces (until we deliver a new model component, but its a mid-term objectvie)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:01): - if your code does not need that, then you should write it as a component  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:01): that's a bit "big picture" comparison, but that's the idea  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:01): if we are using a external library to get the job done..then which is the best implementation  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:01): probably a component  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:01): OK  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:02): but it depends :) what your code should do ?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:02): while learning about plugins   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:02): i went through excel plugin   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:03): want to create a doc plugin similiar to excel plugin .. which uses poi library..  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:03): as excel uses jexcel library ..   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:03): something similiar  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:04): ok  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:04): what do you suggest.?  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:04): if you can do it as a component it's better  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:04): you'll need to read particularly this section http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents#HAccessingacomponentfromvelocity  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:04): yeah i shall go through the tutorials  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:04): as you will need it to be exposed in to velocity scripting  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:05): in the same manner plugins APIs do  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:05): yes, that's the best ;)  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:05): if you dont mide  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:05): \*mind.. can you tell me how can i download the file from fisheye2...?   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:06): some graphs ..   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:06): and history..   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:06): no where theres a link to download the file  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:13): arunreddy: you have to click on a file name  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:14): then click "raw" on the revision that interest you  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:14): but better, you can check out XWiki's source, too ;)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:14): this is a good exercice actually  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:14): building  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:14): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:16): yeah i have xwiki running  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:16): can i find those jars in xe/web-inf/lib  ?  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:16): (if you have checked out already, there are several examples of plugins in the sources)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:16): the tag plugin is there too  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:16): ok  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:17): where can i find them.?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:17): in platform  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:17): ?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:20): ok i will explore and check it out.  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:29): arunreddy: platform/plugins/  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 18:29): and components are under platform/core  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:30): ok  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 18:31): Thanks a lot :)  
ritz - (26/03/2009 19:45): mentors?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 19:57): jvelociter : how to  initialize the log4j system properly.  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 19:57): log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 19:57): arunreddy: hu that's strange I've never seen tjat  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 19:57): (or maybe two years ago :))  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 19:57): ritz: yes  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 19:58): hi  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 19:58): :)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 19:58): arunreddy: what did you do ?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 19:58): can you tell me a general way on how to get logs   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 19:58): on console when running the application .. so that we can where we are going wrong.   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:00): trying to include Log4j logger so that i can see whats going on .. !!!  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:03): can we like create this calender application as an applet?>  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:06): ritz: no I don't think it's a good idea  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:07): we would prefer an integration with a JS library  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:07): like smartclient  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:08): with smartGWT for example  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:08): we already have some server-side code for it  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:08): i have ample experience with java  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:09): but never worked in JS  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:09): GWT is java, so that's good for you  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:09): yes, quite right  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:10): Hey what are you  expecting for Wiki Gadgets jvelociter  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:10): ritz: check http://www.smartclient.com/smartgwt/showcase/#simple\_calendar\_category  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:11): arunreddy: I don't really know more than what's on the project description  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:11): is smile gadget a component .?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:11): the one you built  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:11): you should talk with guillaume lerouge or ludovic dubost  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:11): okies  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:11): oh sorry  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:12): I thought you meant desktop and web widgets  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:12): well  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:12): should i talk to guillaume?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:12): yeah   
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:12): for wiki activity gadget, the idea is any gadget that display information that is relevant to wiki users  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:12): or wiki admins  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:13): part of the work is finding out what gadget are relevant there  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:13): I only gave some examples  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:13): ritz: yes, you can  
ancutagheorghe - (26/03/2009 20:13): heey jvelociter , i applied  for the "anti vandalism filters" project .. do you have any references for me? things to read?  xwiki tutorials to learn so i can get familiar with it?  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:13): ancutagheorghe: it's all there http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/  
ancutagheorghe - (26/03/2009 20:14): ok, thank you :)  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:14): ok  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:14): ancutagheorghe: you can search the mail archives, there are some interesting discussions on anti vandalism  
ancutagheorghe - (26/03/2009 20:14): oh, good to know, thank you again :)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:15): arunreddy: for this subject, the implementation is more or less free, you have to find out what library is adequate for the gadget you want  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:15): to implement  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:15): here too I gave google vizualisation and simile as example  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:16): but I'm sure there are plenty of others that would fit  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:16): yeah .. google visualisation api covers most of the stufff  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:16): hmmm  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:17): jvelociter: isn't the simple calender already having all the features?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:17): How did you integrate smile..  is it more or less a component .?  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:17): ritz: yes, it's pretty complete  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:17): ritz: the job is to integrate it and make it a xwiki applicaiton  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:17): meaning: using data from the wiki  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:18): arunreddy: simile is just a JS library  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:18): you can retrieve data from the wiki using the REST api with AJAX and consume that data with simile for example  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:18): normal html js way .?  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:18): ok   
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:18): yes  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:19): you can also write generate part of your JS scripts with the velocity language  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:19): we sometimes use this technic  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:19): u mean the events storage into underlying Xwiki database and all  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:19): ritz: yes  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:20): and packaging as an XWiki application  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:20): ritz: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DataModel  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:20): and http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/ in general  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:21): arunreddy: check this tutorial http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:22): it explains how you can write JavaScript extensions inside the wiki  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:22): (and CSS ones, too)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:22): you can use http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/SkinEditorApplication to make the JS development experience in the wiki better  
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:25): Thanks a lot.   
arunreddy - (26/03/2009 20:25): i will give a try on this  .. and get back to you in case of any trouble.!!  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:25): no pb  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:25): the events go here?  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:25): xwikilistitems  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:26): table name : xwikilistitems  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:26): ritz: you can check out how the current calendar application is buit  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:26): built  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:26): that would be a good step to understand XWiki classes, objects and properties concepts  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:27): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/CalendarApplication  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:27): the concepts are clear i suppose  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:27): i have been doing OOP for more than a year now  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:27): events don't go in xwikilistsitems ;)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:27): at least, not only  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:28): ritz: it's different  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:28): analogy  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:28): :)  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:28): ok..giving it a detail read  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:28): no inheritence in XWiki  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:28): (yet)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:28): :)  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:29): ok  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:29): "and we are talking about real edible cookies in this analogy; not Web cookies"  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:29): that was helpful  
ritz - (26/03/2009 20:29): i really started wondering what a cookie cutter is  
ugupta - (26/03/2009 20:31): Hi jvelocitier  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:31): got to go  
jvelociter - (26/03/2009 20:31): bback later  
xwikibot - (26/03/2009 21:17): XWiki.dmeddaugh was modified by XWiki.dmeddaugh (Created user) - http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/dmeddaugh  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (26/03/2009 21:43): hai ludobot  
ChathuraPrabuddh - (26/03/2009 21:45): need some information about survey reporting
